title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 31.2 - Procedure for issuance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 31.2 - Procedure for issuance

State Regulations

If such certificate is to be used by the insured for the
purpose of securing the issuance of a motor vehicle registration, the
certificate shall be given to the insured, as soon as practical, except that if
the effective time of coverage is other than 12:01 a.m., such certificate shall
not be given to the insured until such time has been reached. If the
certificate is not to be used for the purpose of securing the issuance of
registration, the insurer, employee, or agent, or authorized representative, shall, as soon as possible, but in no event later than 14 calendar days after
such policy or binder becomes effective, file the certificate of insurance
directly with the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles, by mail or personal delivery, at his office at Albany, N.Y. (financial security
subsection). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
31.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
